intro: Phragmotheca siderosa, commonly known as the ironbark phragmos, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers. Phragmotheca siderosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is an important component of local ecosystems.
